page.title: 01Garway Village
page.content: Garway is a linear village in Herefordshire, on the Welsh border. The SW corner of our block is just in Wales. Garway is brooded over by Garway Hill (1202ft.), the Graig Syfyrddin (1144ft.), and, more distantly, the Black Mountains. The River Monnow forms the national boundary. The whole area is primarily grazing land for cattle and sheep. Garway was once owned by the Knights Templars and Hospitallers, and the original village church was circular. On the adjoining farm there is an ancient dovecot. The Garway Moon Inn is opposite a part of Garway Common which has been cleared for sports and recreational purposes. Garway is served by one bus, which goes to Ross-on-Wye, 10 miles away.
